reviewText: "Digital One-Stop" means: TREELINE, which translates these days to: MILL CREEK ENTERTAINMENT. Their themed single disc series have long ago been superseded by MCE's 20, 50, and 100 movie packs (which are also a better bargain). Volume #1 of TREELINE's "Family Classics" is mislabeled as a 4 movie pack. It actually contains ONE feature film ("Till the Clouds Roll By"), ONE programmer ("The Medicine Man") and a pair of two-reel 3 Stooges shorts. Only the first of these four is in color. All are public domain, none being restored. Transfer quality is acceptable and worth the bargain price. Related item-- Volume 2 of TREELINE's FAMILY CLASSICS has an East Side Kids programmer, a Stooge short and two melodramas, one starring Liz Taylor and the other a made-for-TV George C. Scott costumer. Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 imdb viewer poll ratings. (7.7) Disorder in the Court (1936) - Moe Howard/Larry Fine/Curly Howard/Bud Jamison/Tiny Jones/Edward LeSaint (6.8) Malice in the Palace (1949) - Moe Howard/Larry Fine/Shemp Howard/Vernon Dent/George J. Lewis/Frank Lackteen (5.1) The Medicine Man (1930) - Jack Benny/Betty Bronson/Eva Novak/Tom Dugan (6.4) Till the Clouds Roll By (1946) - June Allyson/Judy Garland/Kathryn Grayson/Van Heflin/Lena Horne/Van Johnson/Tony Martin/Dinah Shore/Frank Sinatra/Robert Walker/Gower Champion/Cyd Charisse/Angela Lansbury/Virginia O'Brien (uncredited: Ether Williams/James Finlayson/'Snub' Pollard)
